chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
w: world
s: state

Goal:
w = Unit -> s = Unit -> Coh w s

Premises:
Notation Unit := @PCM.unit
Coh = fun (w : world) (s : state) => [/\ valid w, valid s, hook_complete w, dom w.1 =i dom s & forall l : Label, coh (getProtocol w l) (getStatelet s l)] : world -> Pred state
unit_coh : forall (w : world) (s : state), Coh w s -> w = Unit < -> s = Unit
cohD : forall (w : world) (s : state), Coh w s -> dom w =i dom s
cohW : forall (w : world) (s : state), Coh w s -> valid w
cohH : forall (w : world) (s : state), Coh w s -> hook_complete w
cohS : forall (w : world) (s : state), Coh w s -> valid s
coh_coh : forall (w : world) (s : state) (l : Label), Coh w s -> coh (getProtocol w l) (getStatelet s l)
hook_complete = fun w : world => hooks_consistent w w : world -> Prop
seq_last_in : forall (A : eqType) (s : seq A) (x : A), last x s \notin s -> s = [::]
consume_msg = fun (s : soup) (id : mid) => match find id s with | Some m => upd id (mark_msg m) s | None => s end : soup -> mid -> soup
prod_join0E : forall (U V : tpcm) (x y : prodPCM U V), x \+ y = Unit -> x = Unit /\ y = Unit
UnionClassTPCM.join0E : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (f1 f2 : U), f1 \+ f2 = Unit -> f1 = Unit /\ f2 = Unit
TPCMMixin : forall (U : pcm) (undef_op : U) (unitb_op : U -> bool), (forall x : U, reflect (x = Unit) (unitb_op x)) -> (forall x y : U, x \+ y = Unit -> x = Unit /\ y = Unit) -> ~~ valid undef_op -> (forall x : U, undef_op \+ x = undef_op) -> TPCM.mixin_of U
getProtocol = fun (w : world) (i : Label) => match find i w with | Some p => p | None => EmptyProt i end : world -> Label -> protocol
DepMaps.DepMaps.Exports.dep_unit : forall (V : Type) (labF : V -> DepMaps.DepMaps.Label) (d : DepMaps.DepMaps.Exports.depmap labF), DepMaps.DepMaps.dmap d = Unit -> d = DepMaps.DepMaps.unit labF
domeq0E : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (f : U), dom_eq f Unit -> f = Unit
join0E : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (f1 f2 : U), f1 \+ f2 = Unit < -> f1 = Unit /\ f2 = Unit
getStatelet = fun (s : state) (i : Label) => match find i s with | Some d => d | None => empty_dstatelet end : state -> Label -> dstatelet
last_key_dom : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V), valid f -> last_key f \notin dom f -> f = Unit
dom0E : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (f : U), valid f -> dom f =i pred0 -> f = Unit
big_pmorph : forall (R1 : Type) (R2 : pcm) (f : R2 -> R1) (id1 : R1) (op1 : R1 -> R1 -> R1), (forall x y : R2, valid (x \+ y) -> f (x \+ y) = op1 (f x) (f y)) -> f Unit = id1 -> forall (I : Type) (r : seq I) (P : pred I) (F : I -> R2), valid (bigop.BigOp.bigop Unit r (fun i : I => bigop.BigBody i PCM.join (P i) (F i))) -> f (bigop.BigOp.bigop Unit r (fun i : I => bigop.BigBody i PCM.join (P i) (F i))) = bigop.BigOp.bigop id1 r (fun i : I => bigop.BigBody i op1 (P i) (f (F i)))
Record mixin_of (U : pcm) : Type := Mixin { undef_op : PCM.sort U; unitb_op : U -> bool; _ : forall x : U, reflect (x = Unit) (unitb_op x); _ : forall x y : U, x \+ y = Unit -> x = Unit /\ y = Unit; _ : is_true (~~ valid undef_op); _ : forall x : U, undef_op \+ x = undef_op } Arguments TPCM.Mixin [U undef_op] [unitb_op]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope _ _%function_scope
last_key0 : forall V : Type, last_key Unit = 0
getLocal = fun (n : nid) (d : dstatelet) => match find n (dstate d) with | Some h => h | None => Unit end : nid -> dstatelet -> heap
pcm_unitE : forall U : pcm, Unit = PCM.unit_op (PCM.class U)
empty_dstatelet = {| dstate := empty_lstate [::]; dsoup := Unit |} : dstatelet
joinE0 : forall (U : tpcm) (x y : U), x \+ y = Unit < -> (x = Unit) * (y = Unit)
getLocalU : forall (n : nid) (m : [ordType of nid]) (d : dstatelet) (s : soup), valid (dstate d) -> m \in dom (dstate d) -> getLocal n d = getLocal n {| dstate := upd m (getLocal m d) (dstate d); dsoup := s |}
unitL : forall (U : pcm) (x : U), Unit \+ x = x
DepMaps.DepMaps.dmDom_unit : forall (V : Type) (labF : V -> DepMaps.DepMaps.Label), DepMaps.DepMaps.dmDom labF Unit
unitR : forall (U : pcm) (x : U), x \+ Unit = x

```coq
intros.
split.
- apply unit_coh; auto.
- split.
  + apply cohW; auto.
  + split.
    * apply cohH; auto.
    * split.
      - apply cohS; auto.
      - intros l.
        apply coh_coh; auto.
Qed.

original: intros. split. - apply unit_coh; auto. - split. + apply cohW; auto. + split. * apply cohH; auto. * split. - apply cohS; auto. - intros l. apply coh_coh; auto.
